Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2009 08:18AM AnnieMc wrote: zoeylovely, The federal government funds community health centers whose mission is to provide primary health care to persons of all ages whether they have health insurance or the ability to pay.  These centers offer a sliding fee scale to persons with low incomes.  Following is a link to a website that can help you find a health center in your area.  http://findahealthcenter.hrsa.gov Good luck!!
Posts.Title: No idea what to do. zoeylovely AnnieMc

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2008 12:39PM AnnieMc wrote: Leslie, I am sorry that you are having to deal with this.  Hopefully, this will be benign, but the waiting does take its toll.  Almost 4 years ago, I had DCIS/IDC on my right breast.  I received lumpectomy, chemo and rads.  18 months after my original diagnosis, I had to have another biopsy of the same breast.  It turned out to be DCIS so I had a matectomy.  That was a little over two years ago and I am quite well.  I do remember the he** of waiting.  For me, the waiting was worse the second time around.  But, once I knew exactly what was up and that I had a promising prognosis, I felt much better. Again, I am hoping for benign results for you.  Take care Anne
Posts.Title: been here.. done that and now I am back dobiew2 LiveForToday
